website_summaries.verdict: The Galaxy Watch Active is a great smartwatch and fitness tracker at a reasonable price, but don’t count on actual blood-pressure monitoring any time soon.
pros: The Galaxy Watch Active's lightweight and simple design make it better for working out and wearing to bed than previous models
It packs in health and fitness features at a lower price than its competitors and works on both Android and iOS
cons: It's missing the rotating bezel we loved on previous Samsung watches and comes in only one size with no LTE option
The blood-pressure monitoring is half baked at best
Samsung's Health app doesn’t make it easy to locate all your data

customer_reviews.title: Poor Activity Tracking/Calorie Burn Tracking
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself was beautiful and felt nice. However, there are issues with the activity tracking and calories burned. As a 5 foot 9 inch woman, there was no way that I had burned over 5800 calories with just a 30 minute walk before 1:00 PM. If you are looking to use this purely as a smart watch, I would recommend. If you want this as a fitness and health tracker, look elsewhere. I am in the process of returning this watch.
customer_reviews.author: ShannyLu

customer_reviews.title: I really like it!!
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight and does everything my Fitbit Versa does and more. It pairs nicely with my S9 and I can choose what notifications I want to get and not get. There's also a pretty nice variety of watch faces to choose from. This watch may not work well for others but it does for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. It has become a necessity. Only thing that kind of sucks about it is that you do have to be very close to your phone for it to work. If I walk from one room to another it will disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bason

customer_reviews.title: Warranty does NOT cover water damage
customer_reviews.text: The FIRST time I tried to go swimming with this watch it broke. I explained what happened to Samsung support, they said that the repair would be covered under warranty, then once they received the watch tried to charge me $140 to fix a $200 watch! They said this is because the damage was caused by water intrusion, even though there was only water intrusion in this case was due to a manufacturing defect! So be warned, the watch is "waterproof" but if the one you get isn't it's not Samsung's fault and they wont pay for it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: No blood pressure monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I have high blood pressure and got this watch because I wanted to track my blood pressure during the day and when I exercise. When I read this would be a feature offered, I pre-ordered (something I have never ever done and probably will not do again). A watch infrared(?) sensing for blood pressure would be extremely helpful even if I had to calibrate it against a home cuff. I called Samsung and they don't have a time frame when/if they will offer the blood pressure app. Other than that the watch is very nice, had great design, feels great, and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: colivar

customer_reviews.title: does not take blood pressure
customer_reviews.text: I preordered this when Samsung said that it would be able to check your blood pressure now they are saying it will not be released. as a smartwatch it works good its comfortable it has interchangeable bands the battery gets around 24 hours between charges not bad. that being said they failed to launch the blood pressure checker which is the main reason I bought the watch.
customer_reviews.author: bassetdad

customer_reviews.title: Battery sucks, pain to get set up
customer_reviews.text: Battery is a joke. Cant go more than a day/half on a full charge. Takes over 2 hours to charge, the app is a mess couldn't get it synced up with samsung health so cant see my stored data. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Rose gold is a great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice watch. It's easy to use and set up. Its lightweight and the strap is a soft plastic that doesnt irritate my skin. Battery life seems good. Its very customizable on the watch itself or from your connected phone. It has alot of different face and app options to choose from. The rose gold is such a nice color. I've bumped up against walls and stuff and still no scratch, so that's a plus. I would still get a screen protector. I recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Azulla Balouga

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller wrists!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch after using the Asus Zenwatch and Ticwatch E. I bought this watch in hopes of finding a smaller watch. My wrist is only 5.6" and the other watches looked enormous. This watch had all the functionality of my previous watches without the bulk. It does everything I need like activity tracking and phone notifications. I also liked that it came with 2 different sizes of watch bands. I usually always have to order a different band just to wear the watch, but the small band that came with it fit on the 3rd to the smallest size. I did change out the watch band to a previous one I already owned for a different color.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNurse86

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous watch
customer_reviews.text: It's a gorgeous watch! Just what I wanted ❤️ not so big, discrete and does what I need for an amazing price. A little scared the screen will get cracked or scratched, will need to buy a protector. Edit:I didn't know it doesn't have a speaker, not so bothered by it but I didn't know. *There's a lack of apps for tizen... Not so happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Way better then the fitbit versa
customer_reviews.text: I just love this watch. It is very intuitive and was very easy to link to my note 9. I was really upset that my fitbit did not work with spotify and now I can! another benefit over fitbit versa is I can text back from the watch. I will be updating this review after some time.
customer_reviews.author: TacoLovers

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over ticwatch pro
customer_reviews.text: It's got a good battery and does sleep tracking. That's all I ever wanted. I'm coming from a ticwatch pro
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Where is the Blood Pressure Lab ??
customer_reviews.text: I was attracted by Samsung's announcement that the watch will come with Blood Pressure measurement. But to my disappointment, when I received the watch yesterday and the BP feature is nowhere. Really mad and upset........finally leave the watch at home and continuously wear my old tracking belt.
customer_reviews.author: robin f.

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts not even 24 hrs
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch! But the description says the battery lasts for days, they did not include that it only lasts for days if you have it in power saving mode. Wish I would have known that ahead of time just to save some aggravation. Battery lasts not even 24 hours on regular mode. I mainly use it to track my activity and sleeping and it's great!! Even with the battery not lasting as long as I thought, I still love it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smart watch and I attached it to by Samsung Galaxy S8. Connected great and was easy to set up. I'm still learning the ins and outs of it but it has been pretty straight forward. I downloaded a new watch face and was able to customize the menus. I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy buy buy
customer_reviews.text: So this watch literally does everything. Except for being able to have a convo from the watch if you answer a call or make a call it goes to your phone, but that's ok what fool is talking to their wrist. Other than that I have 0 issues with this watch. Customizable all notifications text, voice text too, respond to all social media and emails...checks vitals recognizes movements. Checks heart,breathing. I mean you can not go wrong. Buy this dont settle and get a cheaper version of something different. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Tons of Features in This Slim Watch
customer_reviews.text: My first smartwatch/fitness tracker and I'm extremely happy with it! Initially went with a less expensive product, but it was bulky and not as responsive as this watch. Built in microphone, can choose to receive notifications from phone, tons of workout options for tracking, and the list goes on. After having in on for 12hrs now the battery is at 63%. Looking forward to trying out all of the features.
customer_reviews.author: B_Stock

customer_reviews.title: My review on the GWA.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of using it to track my workouts and I'm not disappointed, not one bit. I wake up at 6 am every day and go to sleep usually at 11 pm and the battery lasts all day in a single full charge. I find it easy to use and this is the first smartwatch I've ever bought. The screen is a 40 mm and I have a big wrist so if you have a big wrist you should think about it or go with the Gear watch. It is very comfortable, I don't notice it that much and it's lightweight. Overall the watch is very good and it was worth the money. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maximuz

customer_reviews.title: Chewing glass is better than buying this overpriced hunk-o-junk!
customer_reviews.text: 1st thing, it will get scratched up unless you get a screen protector. Accuracy? A joke! I clock steps sitting down and doing nothing. It happens constantly. Sleep tracking. It's all bull. Battery life? What battery life? I have 2 cheap fitness watches that are 10x better than this overpriced hunk-o-junk. Don't waste your money. Get a cheap one. More accurate and better battery life by far. This watch really is a total scam. I will never buy a Samsung watch again and I truly recommend that you DO NOT BUY This overpriced hunk-o-junk! That is all.
customer_reviews.author: David W Stone Sr

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented Warranty for product
customer_reviews.text: Had watch for about 9 months when it blacked out. Sent to Samsung for warranty repair. Was told by Samsung that based on serial number, watch was not manufactured for US use and not covered by its warranty. Product description stating US Version with warranty in not correct. Called Amazon and they took the watch back for a partial return. BE CAREFUL WITH seller statements. According to mfr, one can call them to verify if item was intended for sale in US. This seller misrepresented warranty and I will not buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: Imam Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far this watch fits perfectly for my wrist. Battery life is amazing and charges pretty fast. It does come with the base for the charger, but you'll need a connector to plug the USB cord in to. Very beautiful on the eyes, straps can be changed. Very lightweight to the hands and I utilize most of the apps. Easy setup and it arrived on time. Thank you so much Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Latisha A. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Good looking watch, not too gaudy. Came with a charging disk. No instructions though. Was easy to set up through once you then it on it tells you to use the wear app whice was already downloaded onto my phone. I get all notifications snapchat, Facebook, phone calls and text. You can't answer snaps or Facebook on the watch and when you answer the phone call it answers it onto your phone. Haven't responded to a text yet on it but its possible. Glad I decided to spend the money on this instead of buying a cheap Chinese knock off like I planned on originally.
customer_reviews.author: Shley

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious battery life, mediocre performance
customer_reviews.text: You would be lucky to get an hour out if this. I bought it for running (it has Spotify offline so I don't need to bring my phone): With MapmyRun, Spotify, and my Bluetooth headphones in, I can get two 30 min runs out of it. Do NOT buy if you're planning to do any excercise for more than an hour. The device itself is also pretty sluggish. Not terrible given its mostly single purpose for me, but the experience wasn't great as a watch in general. But mostly I am just confused as to why Samsung released a product aimed at activity and included such a weak battery.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Great for texting
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the watch for about a week. I absolutely love it. My favorite part is being able to text by writing letters with finger on the watch itself. I do not use it for working out or tracking anything health-related. I bought it strictly for getting my notifications without grabbing my phone. If I had to complain about something... I find you cannot be very far away from your phone for it to disconnect. Literally, cannot be on the other side of the house. Otherwise I love it. It is light and not too bulky for my thin wrist which was one of my initial concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Navarre

customer_reviews.title: I expect more from Samsung...
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this watch! HUGE CON is the battery life. I will start my 12 hour shift of work with 100% battery and it will be dead an hour before my shift. I have a major issue with this and it frustrates me that I preordered the watch. I expect much more from Samsung!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung lied about the blood pressure function of the Samsung Galaxy Watch Active
customer_reviews.text: I pre-ordered the Samsung Galaxy Watch Active because it was advertised to have blood pressure measuring. However, now it seems like Samsung has pulled the plug on that feature after the watch release. That BP function was the only reason why I was willing to pay 2 hundred dollars for the Samsung Galaxy Watch Active! I could have bought a much cheaper Garmin/Fitbit watch without that feature. Samsung did a bait and switch here. I will be sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked for a year, almost to a day (ordered on 8.4.2019, received on 8.9.2019, problems started in mid-August 2020). After that the battery stopped holding charge. When it gets down to about 70%, it loses rest of the charge in a few minutes. Call to Samsung didn't help: they told me that my warranty ran out in June (apparently it was good for just 10 months), so I will have to pay for the repair, which takes at least two weeks, and that will cost me almost $120. That, of course, doesn't make any sense, it's easier to get another smart watch. My new smart watch will NOT be a Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy Boguslavsky

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot. The features are great! Love the heart rate tracker and the step counter and the other functions. That said the omission of the rotating bezel like its counterparts makes it fragile.. As a consequence my screan cracked after just one minor drop on the ground. I beat the hell out of my galaxy gear sport and never broke..
customer_reviews.author: Melody Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof. Not shockproof. Exactly 24 hours of battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I am a wildland firefighter, and being an "active" device i expected better performance. The screen was cracked, despite having a screen protector on it at the time, in two weeks. Shortly thereafter, i went for a swim, never once going below 5 feet and the watch went blank and hasnt been responsive since. I was not aggressive or abusive in any degree to this watch and it did not meet its claimed specifications to any degree.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I got this to replace my fitbit. The step tracker is WAY off. Super low! For example just this morning I was deep cleaning and moving heavy furniture for like 3 hours.. every time I looked at my watch it kept telling me it was time to start moving! It had me at 109 steps the entire time I was cleaning.. it never went up. And the heart rate monitor is also way off. I was working out and it was at 68 to 70 when in reality it was up around 150. Wish I hadn't got rid of my Fitbit for this junk
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy sport
customer_reviews.text: Shipped super fast. I was surprised that I still use this after many months every day. I know I haven't even tapped into its full potential, but for my need, i.e steps, time, heart rate, emails, texts, social media, calculator, weather, calendar - it's perfect. Everything is right on my wrist. The water proof is a nice feature for being caught in the rain. The band is easily cleaned as it is a soft rubber material. I like the customization of it, too. Well worth the money even for the few apps that I personally use. There are so many more available for other users.
customer_reviews.author: shana

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch but battery sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the functions on the watch and how seamlessly it synchs with my phone (Note 10). Love the color and look. My only negative is the battery life. It's only good for a day. If you want it to track your sleep, you'll have to charge it before going to bed. Its great for monitoring your health but it does not have all the smartwatch capabilities. But thats fine with me, i can do all that stuff on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: RAO

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch. Its my second one. Its light, easy to wear. Love the water lock feature which works great and gets put to the test every time I rinse my horse off after a workout. Its pretty durable and will send an alert to my chosen recipients as well as 911 with my location if I come off my horse and don't respond and shut it off.
customer_reviews.author: sierrarivers

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I have a bad watch but even with battery on power saver I am only getting about 6 hours of life. Unacceptable. It also claims that I walked 10,000 steps when I was asleep and even with workout detectaion disabled it claims I walk when I am driving. Thinking of going back to fitbit. UPDATE: After speaking with Samsung Customer Care they sent me a label to send watch back so they can "repair" it. I don;t know why they can't just send a replacement so I will not have the watch for over a week. Lame
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works but Apps Could be More Flexible
customer_reviews.text: I do enjoy wearing this watch. It is comfortable and I have pretty much figured it out. The one complaint I have is that if I wanted to have text messages show up on my phone that I had to return to the old Samsung default text application on my Note 9. I had moved to the google messaging app which has a couple of features not available in the default text application. Because this forced me to switch apps, I have given only 4 stars. I have not had any problems with this device in the last month and a half I've owned it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lewis

customer_reviews.title: March 2020, 30 hour battery life per charge
customer_reviews.text: March 2020, after 10 days. Boxed and pdf manuals are not as helpful as playing with all menu options. Battery life is about 30 hours after a full charge. Without the bezel, you can still quickly scroll by using 1 finger along the edge. Some say only 1 message is retained, not true, go to messages on the watch and scroll down. There is an unmentioned inactivity warning after 1 hour, I'm still searching for how to modify it. You CANNOT verbally answer phone calls using this version of the watch, but you can reject, or send a text response. Sleep tracking, heartbeat and automatic activation of workouts are good features.
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Don't.
customer_reviews.text: This watch does not use Google services, it requires you to make brand new Samsung accounts for everything and cannot sync with your Google data without trusting shady third party companies. I got so frustrated trying to make the watch operate how I wanted that I had to return it within 24 hours. Android users, Think of every Google thing on your phone right now. Play store, music, maps, wear os, whatever. This watch will wrestle with all of it and tell you to make multiple new 'samsung accounts'. This watch looks like it's perfect but it was the first return I've ever done on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan B.

customer_reviews.title: Revised to 1 star for atrocious performance
customer_reviews.text: Original review below, it's since stopped communicating with my phone so I did factory reset and set it up all over again, did 2 updates, so should be good to go. I do the same walk every morning, it's now off by up to 1200 steps, one morning it says 2032, then next morning it says 3300, for the EXACT SAME WALK... does not know I am sleeping, but joyously send me notifications I to each of the people I was "escalated" to the story as the previous had not, so wasted an hour on the phone before finally giving up, which is obviously what samsung wants you to do. Save the FRUSTRATION buy anything else!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Watch is not working good, bought it in August and for the past 8 days the screen stop working and also doesn’t hold charge to long just like 8-9 hours with a regular use. The apps in the screen open by the self like you were pushing the buttons on the screen, even when you are not wearing the watch, after that it doesn’t recognized any function on the screen or to turn off the phone since the screen doesn’t work. I went to store in Colombia and they say Samsung doesn’t have international warranty . So tell me what I can do?
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: The watch is inaccurate at counting steps, screen is too small and navigating through the watch is terrible. I'm really bummed, because I really wanted to like it. I recently switched from iPhone to Galaxy S10+ and its awesome, I was hoping this watch would be a great addition to it, but it is not. I really dislike Apple, but the Apple watch is 10x times better. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Loop

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy here!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my watch only to find the instructions are not in English, I went to check the Samsung website and found the same watch for $75 less! I’m pissed!
customer_reviews.author: Kate227

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with great features! perfect for cycling!
customer_reviews.text: Me and my wife have been long time Iphone users and Apple Watch users. couple months ago we switched to the Galaxy S10 which we love. we thought about getting the samsung gear watch but decided that it was ugly and to bulky. Then we noticed they had the galaxy active! We love this smart watch. we prefer the round face rather then the apple watches square face. when we had apple watches, our watches would only last from the morning till the night. our galaxy active watches by the end of the day including our workouts only get to 75% which is obviously better then the apple watch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kieper

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing students...
customer_reviews.text: I wish the touch screen went from edge to edge to give us a little more space but other than that I love it. Super sleek and professional looking. I got it for nursing school to make my life a little easier. So far it has helped me with military time, patient respiration, etc... I can't have my phone out during clinicals and being able to respond to my kids on my wrist makes me feel so much better. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: MrsRetailTherapy

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great watch if only...
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great watch if only it had decent battery life. It is terrible. Using only 2 notifications, phone and texts, it used 100% of the battery in less than 6 hours! I deactivated all the other features and am still left with a watch that won't make it through a whole day. So, now I have watch that has no useful function other than keeping time unless I want to interrupt my day to recharge it. Save your money and try a Fitbit or other brand rather than pay $178 for a generic digital watch.
customer_reviews.author: Native Son

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch. Comes with an additional strap if you need more room. Samsung Pay works excellent with. Multiple ways to enter information for text, email, etc. Studio had a water mode, so if you go swimming, remember to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Marginally acceptable functionality and a lot of frustration. This is my 1st product of its type, so i cannot compare to anything. Very clumsy and frustrating to operate. Randomly detects and tracks types of exercise. No more than ballpark accuracy detecting & tracking heart rate. Needs to be charged at least once every day. Face is too small for a touch screen . Three star rating is very generous.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Oberg

customer_reviews.title: Band sucks, watch is great though
customer_reviews.text: So I love the watch its self. What I dont love is the silicone band. It gets so sticky and nasty so I always have to clean it. I live where it's very humid so I'm forever cleaning it. Other than that i love it.
customer_reviews.author: jami

customer_reviews.title: It's an Average Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second smartwatch I've ever owned, but one of many that I have used; and I have to say, this is just a very average watch. There's nothing all that great about it. The screen feels kind of small, the band is meh and the step tracking counts different from my phone (not sure if my phone or my watch is tracking correctly). It is an okay watch, but I probably wouldn't buy it again. At least I got a free wireless charger out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cady Heron

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Warranty Failed
customer_reviews.text: Loved this watch until it broke. Still in the 1 year manufacturer's warranty but when sent in for repair was told the LED screen going black is not covered under the warranty! $159 to fix. You can buy a new one for that price.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great watch - useful, does what you expect, but wish it had more apps.
customer_reviews.text: The watch works pretty much as you'd expect. It's pretty good at auto detecting when you start working out, and sleep tracking is also pretty good. Heart rate monitor is fine, but the continuous stress level seems to be non-functional / gimmicky. Tizen doesnt' have an app for Google Play Music, so in order to control playback from your watch, the app must be running on your phone, effectively turning your watch into a remote (like a bluetooth headset).
customer_reviews.author: JLLouis

customer_reviews.title: Must use Samsung apps, even with non-Samsung devices
customer_reviews.text: Why would I want to enable a completely new set of companies to have even more access to my personal data. I accept that Google has pretty much everything about me, but to have to give that same access to Samsung and use their apps and their ecosystem is a bridge too far. RETURNED
customer_reviews.author: Deven

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I personally do not recommend buying this watch! I have so far, in the past MONTH, had 2 seperate watches and they are both having the identical problem!! I am sending the bezel back to Samsung for repair, I have no confidence this will help solve my problem...I wish I never bought this watch at all! I don't know why the first time I received a new watch and this time I have to go through Samsung for repair!! If this doesn't solve my problems, I will demand my money back!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband and it ended up being a little small on his wrist so I took it and got him a larger size. It works as it should. Shows me texts and allows me to respond. I can answer my phone and change my music or control volume from the watch. It also tracks health related things such as water intake, calories, steps, and more. Many free watch faces to personalize it and I bought other bands to dress it up. I tested water mode the other day when I went swimming in Lake Michigan and it again worked as it should. I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Evans

customer_reviews.title: I should of bought something a little better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep time, count steps during the day, and for running. The time keeping works great, the step counting glitches and the running glitches more. If you are a runner then you know how aggravating it would be to have something not work while doing so. I am not happy with the overall quality of these functions.
customer_reviews.author: Wes H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Tracking is a bit off, software is lacking, but my main reason for the post is that the band is already deteriorating. I've been wearing it for two weeks, max; haven't taken it to the ocean or pool, and generally been taking great care.
customer_reviews.author: Tal Hassid

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch. Battery life is two days with normal use, six days with power saver mode. It's helping me get my health back under control with stress monitoring, sleep tracking as well as the reminders to be active throughout the day or to slow down and breathe when I'm stressed out. I also find I'm on my phone a lot less because I get notifications on the watch which let's me know if it's something I really need to answer (usually not!). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Moulden

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life so far. Too much bloatware.
customer_reviews.text: I got it while I was on vacation so the battery seemed fine initially. Then went back to work (I'm a server, so I'm running around). By the end of my shift I have to put the watch in battery power saver mode. Also, there is a lot of bloatware that you cannot uninstall, which is very annoying (does anyone even use Bixby?). Having a hard time figuring out which apps I can put to sleep so they don't drain the battery. I will update when the need arises. Have only had the watch for 8 days.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't communicate with WW. Pointless.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this watch except one vital thing, which will lead to me either ditching it in a drawer or selling it. It won't communicate with WW. (Weight watchers) So, I'll be going back to fitbit ASAP. Everything else, amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Agustta Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Not a US version
customer_reviews.text: This is not a US version with warranty as advertised. User manual came in Spanish and watch booted up in Spanish. Samsung pay app is not available for this watch but is on the one purchased from best buy. Galaxy plug in app encounters error when trying to install. Bought it for a gift for my mother. I wanted to return it but my mother says she wants to keep it because those things aren't important to her. I am getting sick of this false advertising on Amazon and nothing being done to prevent it. Watch is sleak though. If what was advertised would have been shipped it would have gotten a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the casual user.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Gear Fit2 to this watch and I'm thrilled! The device is durable, looks nice on my wrist, does everything I need a smartwatch to do, and is waterproof as well. The performance on this is a nice upgrade from the Gear Fit2, and the screen is certainly better. Battery life is also better, and I'm getting two days comfortably on this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. Has a multitude of widgets and syncs great with my Samsung Galaxy. I have continuous heart rate on and that likely kills my battery faster than average but I have to charge about every 1 day 12 hrs. I usually put in low power mode while sleeping (heartrate monitor doesn't work in this setting however) and that gives me much more battery. Screen is VERY resistant to scratches but I'd recommend a tempered glass case for it. My fitbit versa lasted longer but it was also plagued with update issues so I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonuser2k5

customer_reviews.title: Get the Active 2 instead
customer_reviews.text: Battery life in this is very poor; have to charge this almost daily. Exercise tracking is definitely hit or miss. Did a full exercise routine yesterday and nothing was tracked. Another time it told me I had been walking for an hour and more when I was sitting around home due to Covid-19. Wish I had gotten the newer Active 2, hopefully that one would have performed much better
customer_reviews.author: therealtimz

customer_reviews.title: Band worn-out quickly and the metal housing is sratched
customer_reviews.text: Expecting higher quality from Samsung Band worn-out in a week and notice the metal housing paint is peeling off too. Like the display and the light weight of the product. Wireless charging is convenient and kind of working on the S10 phone. A few disconnection happened in the course of the charging. You need to use about 60% of the phone battery to get the watch from 0-100%.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: This is the best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this watch. Bought 2 Fitbit Versa watches and sent those back for horrible bluetooth for music. These are excellent and flawless. Love the sleep tracker, step tracker, heartbeat monitor, stress tracker, and music player! Battery life is not as bad as I thought reading reviews. Just charge it for an hour or two a day and it's good to go. Would be nice if it lasted longer, but everything else about the watch is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: SteelTX

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: The only con I have of this watch is the weight. The rest is pros! Ready to be depressed? Make sure and track your sleep! This is pretty accurate. Tracks steps with accuracy, it detects when you are exercising. The UI is easy and intuitive, updates with ease. Overall great watch if you're looking at getting healthy, in more ways than one.
customer_reviews.author: deadman31299

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this watch but I am super disappointed with it. It disconnects with my phone a lot and so I miss calls and text messages and doesn't sync weather updates or anything else regularly. The most disappointing thing is the fitness tracking app is terrible. I used fitbit for a few years and I was looking forward to a fitness tracker that worked better with my phone. It doesn't do a great job at anything but being cute and telling time. Booo!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great looking smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I've had Garmins for years and decided to try something new. I love the watch, but I miss using my Garmin app. It seems way better than the Samsung but that is fine, it tells me what I need. I ended up buy and protective shell for the screen since I bump into things a lot and it has keep it in great shape. The charge lasts for a good amount of time. I usually charge it every night but it easily lasts over 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Lindi Krauss

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, no speaker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my watch. The Wearable App on my Galaxy Note 10 helps me setup and sync the apps and widgets to the watch. I mainly use it for exercise purposes because it has GPS. I can walk/run without carrying my phone with me. And it syncs my data to my phone when I return to it. It does not have a speaker, so you can't play music on it. You can answer calls, but you can't hear the person on the other side. Overall, if you want it for exercise, text/email notifications, and calendar updates, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: V. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Bad outweighs good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if its accurate on the step counter, I miss the toggle frame thing, and its harder to text on than the gear 2 I had. But other than that, I love how its smaller (I have tiny wrists), how it's waterproof (since I'm military and spend some time outdoors in wet conditions), and everything else about it is great. I do miss having more options for watch faces, but I'm sure those will come with time. Overall, the bad outweighs the good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I was getting less than 24 hrs on a charge. Watch did not automatically track my activity. Was indicating inactivity hours when I was walking around the house. Was not counting my steps. Not registering arm curls or recumbent bike. HR (Pulse) seemed to be fairly accurate. I returned the watch for a activ 2 watch with hopes that this upgrade will do what I expect it to do. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Great watch & app
customer_reviews.text: All around great watch and the app is great also. I do not sleep with it so I can't speak on that. The battery is not as great as other watches, it lasts 2-3 days, but I'm ok with that. Lots of watch faces, many features. Some say you cannot respond to text on watch but I can through preselected messages and handwriting (doodle). You can also make and answer a call through watch but there's no speaker so you need your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip & Laura

customer_reviews.title: The watch comes without a charger
customer_reviews.text: I just got the watch. Overall, I am quite pleased with it even though it is really too early to tell. However, the most disappointing thing is that the watch does not come with a charger, not even the cable only. If it was mentioned in the product details that it does not have a charger I would have made sure to order one, as I have nothing to do with a watch I cannot charge. I now have to order a charger and wait a long while until the charger arrives (I do not live in the US). Please add this to your product description to save this from future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: PROS: I love the feel and size of the watch. I have tiny wrists with a prominent bony bump, so I rarely wore my previous Samsung watch because big bulky watches are too uncomfortable to wear. The usability is fine. The smooth, sleek look is great! CONS: It did not come with any kind of charger. NADA. WTF?? And battery life is not great.
customer_reviews.author: RuthB

customer_reviews.title: Much better value than the active 2
customer_reviews.text: Initially wanted to get the active 2 but the updates have tricked down to this one, and there isn't any other *useful* differences anyway so I got this one as a gift for my SO. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Az

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: When I received this watch, it was a great item. However, after 9 months of regular, day to day use, the sensors that track heart rate, steps and sleep cycles all failed and just 3 days later, the display completely failed and is permanently black. As for the warranty? Have approximately 4 months to wait for it to be fixed and returned? I don't...
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Sandgren

customer_reviews.title: 5 Things That I Wish I Knew Before I Bought
customer_reviews.text: 1.) Not very much apps. Very little options on the store. 2.)Very fragile on the screen. I had to put a cover on it. Scratches easily. 3.)Operates a bit slow for 2020 technology. There is a bit lag between operations but it isn't a deal breaker. 4.)Settings a bit shallow. I couldn't find how to turn off the screen saving for so long. 5.)I saved good things for the last, It's lightweight, sleek design, and comfortable. For $149 It's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Hasan Can

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch !
customer_reviews.text: Worth the dollars absolutely and didn't find an issue with my open box option. Came with the included charger, and was able to register with Samsung. Suprprisely with the new software update most of the user interface with the newest watch is also found with this model. Didn't find that in any YouTube review. Get a screen protector and expect the band to be basic great for active lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it , I'm a Tiny person with a small wrist and it fit perfectly without looking like I have a clock on my arm. Worth the buy , sleek, comfortable, good quality and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: As a smart watch for a couple of simple apps like a timer app and to see who's calling, it's fine. But for an activity and health tracker, its terrible. It can't read a consistent heart beat during sleep nor exercise regardless of how I wear it, which may be the root of the problems. The stats on sleep quality and workout activities are not accurate or reliable. And even if it were accurate, the data is not rich enough to be actionable. It makes me miss my MS band. I would not recommend this product to anyone and will be looking for a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My second smartwatch after the gear s2, not disappointed at all. Easy to connect to your phone, sleek design, small and comfortable on your wrist (at least on mine). I don't mind the thick bezels, and the missing rotating bezel. If you're looking for a "cheap" smartwatch, this is one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Yukio Nang

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband and he loves everything about it. He’s not a tech guy but needed this. He doesn’t miss any calls now because he wears this watch. He’s in and out of hospital s all day and while making deliveries he has to turn his phone on silent. This is a perfect option. At least he will know that someone called
customer_reviews.author: justice

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I returned this watch was that that the heart rate monitor completely useless while working out, which is the main reason I purchased the watch. It can't pick up a HR at all if you have a miniscule amount of sweat on your wrist. Overall, I was not impressed with the ease of use, materials used to make the watch, or anything else about it.
customer_reviews.author: SigGuy938

customer_reviews.title: If you've been waiting for a pixel watch from google and wear OS, just stop and buy this watch
customer_reviews.text: Seriously just give up on that dream. What makes a Pixel great is the software and Wear OS sucks. This watch is fantastic. It tracks my runs with ease, tracks all my steps, and syncs with all the health app on my phone. GPS is very accurate. IMO, it has all the apps that you need. I don't need 50 apps on my smartwatch. I just need notifications from my phone, tell the time, and gps for runs. But it and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucjul

customer_reviews.title: Best smartwatch ever
customer_reviews.text: I've seen people spending a lot of money in their Apple Watches, but let me tell you that this cheaper smartwatch has everything you need. It's elegant, sophisticated and works perfect. it's the best investment I ever did in personal technology. There's just one thing to have into account, the battery lasts almost two days, so remember charging it at night.
customer_reviews.author: María Arce

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Watch Review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: battery last all day Send & receive texts / FB messages Recieve all my phone alerts that I set up Counts steps / measures heart rate Easy set up watch to phone Let's you choose watch face theme Con: need 2 apps Samung Wearable (already on my phone) and Sumsung Health to work it right
customer_reviews.author: T. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it when you want to use it with an iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Probably works great with Samsung phones. Very buggy with iPhone. Blood pressure feature only works with android.
customer_reviews.author: MAC User MV

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my watch! Have had it for about a year now and I dont think there's one thing i would change about it! I had the Huawei watch before this one and loved it until it broke so I was worried about getting the samsung because of a few negative reviews about it, but they were all so wrong! I would buy this watch over and over again! And it truly it water resistant so it works perfect for summer days or swimming workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Rashell

customer_reviews.title: Low Battery Life, Difficult to Handle Apps
customer_reviews.text: I had to charge this watch every single day since I have received it. I am simply appalled by the short battery life. I also can't set its apps properly; for example, it was impossible to add a desired location for the world watch. Very expensive for the little it can do
customer_reviews.author: Pavic

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: It's good looking, functioning, has all the capabilities I'm looking for but the battery only lasts 24 hours. It takes a long time to charge and only connects to my phone half the time. I used to have a fitbit versa which went black screen after a year and a half. Unfortunately I think I'd rather have the fitbit since it only needed charging once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch, does it all
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my android phone. It's the perfect pairing of fitness watch and smart watch. The fitness tracking features are easy to use, accurate, and offer a wide variety. The phone features work great, are easy to use, and allow access to all essential phone functions. I use mine primarily as a step counter, cycling computer, and to text. Visually, I like it a lot. It's big enough to see everything but small enough to be comfortable and aesthetically pleasing for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: Stef Nevells

customer_reviews.title: Concise
customer_reviews.text: I loooove my watch. I've been through 2 Fitbits and they both can't compare. I'm and RN and this watch is pretty durable. The step count is pretty accurate, however, the flight of stairs count is not always concise. The Samsung health app is not the greatest but it gets the job done. I can definitely say I am satisfied with this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Roseboro

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Adorable and simple
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, get notifications and calls, not, very many options for regular apps on watch, good heart monitor and steps counter. Appealing and quick, light weight, however it does tend to disconnect frequently and using Spotify from the watch drains the battery quickly. Average use of the watch will last through the day. Overall simplistic and has main necessities.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Zanotti

customer_reviews.title: Bad app
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad watch, the app need's serious work. I can't see my sleep in the app like the apple or evan cheap knock off watches can. I have severe tinnitus and the VA wants to track my sleep. This watch won't let me show them how I've been doing. For a $200.00 dollar watch I would have expected more features.
customer_reviews.author: Bill n Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Nicw but short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Comfy. Works in that tells time and shows my texts messages and fb messages. Yay. But the bayteryblife STINKS. TOO SHORT. I get like 8 hours. So I am never able to get a true read of my acrivity, my steps, or my sleep. I have to charge it 2 or 3x in a 24 hour period. Yes, I charge until.100%
customer_reviews.author: Meg Chicago Peach

customer_reviews.title: A little buggy on my Pixel 3a
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful screen. I learned that my Facer app even off the Galaxy store app itself is not compatible with my watch. Once I reset the watch and didn't install Facer it worked pretty well. Sometimes the AOD stops working. I found that if I take off the watch and clean off the back it will work again. Everything else seems to be fine 😁
customer_reviews.author: journey13164

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great for everyday use as well as fitness. It's got a great fit and stylish if you are looking for style. Its light weight to where you cant tell you have a watch on. It has a wide range of apps and the only improvement I would make on this would be to customize the home background with one of my own photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch!!!! Tried buying a cheap smart watch and they are a joke. The Samsung's are definitely worth the money. Very easy to use and keeps up with everything , very accurate. Only thing I wish this one had is a speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw away your money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought beacause my last Samsung watch lasted for a couple of years & I have never had an issue with any of my Samsung devices. I really liked this for a couple of weeks, then the battery life went dramatically down. Now I can not use it for sleep tracking because it will not last throughout the night. It now spends more time on the charger than my wrist. (At full charge it last maybe 4hrs). Waste of my money! Don't waste yours!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price plus more
customer_reviews.text: Such a beautiful screen. This is my 2nd smart watch. I had the moto 360 years ago. This tops it in every way. Perfect size for a smaller wrist. Gets almost 2 days battery life. Turned off automatic heart sensor. Use it in the gym 3 times a week. And I track sleep. Tracks my runs very well and keeps me active.
customer_reviews.author: ryan pitaroll

customer_reviews.title: Samsung quality, at a low price
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a capable watch, but you think FitBits are lame? Me too! Happy to say that this watch fits that bill perfectly. Good design, lightweight, waterproof, plenty of sensors and features, and way below the price of the new model Samsung Gear or Apple watch.
customer_reviews.author: OhWerd

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch Active (40mm, GPS, Bluetooth), Rose Gold (US Version)
product_meta.description: The lightweight, yet durable Galaxy Watch Active understands the way you work out. With auto workout tracking, you’ll have the power to reach new goals. Plus a suite of apps help you to monitor your stress and sleep while you stay connected.Processor Speed, Type : 1.15GHz. Battery 247mAh (milli-Amp-hour).
feature_bullets: Track your way to real results: Automatically detects up to 6 exercises, while tracking up to 39 more, right from your wrist
Resolve to rest better: Helps you analyze your sleep patterns and encourages you to wind down to keep you refreshed and at your best
Sends you real time alerts if ever detecting a high or low heart rate, so you can be more proactive about your heart health
Expand your Galaxy: Sync with your phone to stream your playlist, get notifications and more, right on your wrist
Thin; Light; Durable: A thin, lightweight and durable swim ready design comes in a variety of colors and interchangeable bands
Lasts for days: Go non stop with a long lasting battery that lasts for days on a single charge
